personal.name: Cristina Tuazon
personal.title: Full Stack Developer | Graphic Designer | Database Specialist
personal.summary: Passionate full stack developer and database specialist with strong experience in building web applications, designing user-centric interfaces, and producing academic research outputs. Currently exploring AI development, RAG pipelines, and model integration to expand technical depth.
personal.elevator_pitch: I build efficient, scalable web applications using Laravel, MySQL, and modern front-end frameworks. I combine strong system architecture skills with design proficiency and research experience, allowing me to deliver complete, end-to-end solutions tailored to user needs.

career_goals.short_term: Secure a position as a database specialist, backend developer or AI-integrated full stack developer, contributing to projects that involve designing, maintaining, and optimizing databases, building scalable web applications, and integrating AI/ML workflows such as RAG systems.
career_goals.long_term: Become a senior backend or AI systems engineer with deep expertise in database architecture, full stack development, and AI integration. Lead projects that optimize business or educational processes, mentor junior developers, and contribute to innovative AI-driven solutions.

behavioral.question: Tell me about a time you had to lead a difficult technical decision
behavioral.answer: In a freelance project, I was responsible for selecting the most suitable Laravel libraries for authentication and admin panel features. I carefully compared options like Fortify, Breeze, and Filament, considering factors such as security, ease of integration, and long-term maintainability. I consulted with the client to understand their needs, documented my evaluation process, and recommended a combination that balanced flexibility and reliability. The project was delivered smoothly, and the client appreciated my thorough, user-focused approach to technical decision-making.

behavioral.question: Describe a project where you had to learn a new technology quickly
behavioral.answer: For my thesis project, I needed to develop a full-featured web application using Laravel, but I didn’t have much experience with its advanced features. I dedicated extra time to studying documentation, watching tutorials, and experimenting with different packages. By breaking down the requirements and learning as I built, I was able to deliver a robust system on time. This experience taught me the importance of adaptability and reinforced my confidence in picking up new technologies quickly.

behavioral.question: How do you handle conflicting priorities and tight deadlines?
behavioral.answer: I prioritize by clarifying requirements, breaking tasks into manageable steps, and communicating proactively with stakeholders. I stay calm under pressure, focus on solutions, and am not afraid to ask for help or negotiate deadlines if needed. My goal is always to deliver quality work while maintaining a positive, collaborative environment.

technical.question: Walk me through your approach to system design for a high-traffic application
technical.answer: I start by understanding user needs and expected load, then design a scalable architecture—often using a layered approach with caching, load balancing, and database optimization. I value clear documentation and modular code, and I’m always open to feedback from more experienced engineers. My goal is to build systems that are robust, maintainable, and user-focused.

technical.question: How would you implement a real-time notification system?
technical.answer: Given my experience with Laravel and JavaScript, I would implement a real-time notification system using Laravel’s broadcasting features together with a service like Pusher. I’d set up event broadcasting in Laravel to trigger notifications, and use JavaScript on the frontend to listen for these events and update the UI instantly. This approach is reliable, integrates well with my existing tech stack, and provides a smooth user experience. I’m always open to learning more advanced solutions as project needs grow.

technical.question: Explain your experience with microservices architecture
technical.answer: While most of my experience is with monolithic and modular systems, I have studied microservices concepts and understand their benefits for scalability and maintainability. I’m excited to deepen my hands-on experience and am proactive about learning from team members who have worked extensively with microservices.

situational.question: A critical production bug is affecting customers. Walk me through your response process
situational.answer: First, I would stay calm and acknowledge the urgency. I’d communicate transparently with stakeholders, gather all relevant information, and work methodically to identify the root cause. I believe in documenting the process and sharing lessons learned to prevent future issues. My focus is always on restoring service quickly while maintaining a positive, solution-oriented attitude.

situational.question: How would you approach mentoring a struggling team member?
situational.answer: I would listen to understand their challenges, offer encouragement, and share resources or techniques that have helped me. I believe in fostering a supportive environment where everyone feels comfortable asking questions. My goal is to help others grow and succeed, which ultimately strengthens the whole team.

situational.question: Describe how you would evaluate and implement a new technology in your team
situational.answer: I’d start by researching the technology’s benefits and potential drawbacks, then run a small proof of concept. I’d gather feedback from the team and consider how it aligns with our goals. If it adds value, I’d help plan a smooth rollout and provide documentation or training. I’m always open to learning and sharing new ideas.

research_areas.insight: I always review a company’s mission and values to ensure my own goals and work ethic align. I appreciate organizations that value growth, collaboration, and innovation.
I research recent launches to understand the company’s direction and how I can contribute. I enjoy learning about new features and thinking about how users benefit.
I look for teams that encourage learning, knowledge sharing, and open communication. I thrive in environments where feedback is valued and everyone is willing to help each other grow.
I’m motivated by technical challenges and enjoy brainstorming solutions with others. I see challenges as opportunities to learn and make a positive impact.

preparation_questions.question: What excites you about our product?
preparation_questions.answer: I’m excited by products that solve real problems and have a clear vision. I appreciate the opportunity to contribute to something meaningful and to learn from talented colleagues.

preparation_questions.question: Why do you want to work here?
preparation_questions.answer: I’m drawn to your company’s commitment to innovation and growth. I value environments where I can learn, contribute, and be part of a supportive team.

preparation_questions.question: What questions do you have for us?
preparation_questions.answer: I’d love to hear more about your team’s approach to professional development and how you support continuous learning. What are some of the biggest technical challenges you’re currently facing or have faced?
